topics.name: Critical Success Factors of Korea and Nigeria's e-Government

questions.text: Who discovered e-Gov Project Planning and Development?
What is the capital of Korea?
Where is Korea???
When is Korea>?

----------------- are resources that are put into the project
a) Outcomes
b) Sources
c) Inputs
d) Outputs
e) Evaluation

The following are example of e-government’s benefits except 
a) Tackling Corruption
b) It enhances  communication between the different Government department and Agencies 
c) Automates processes to take away discretion 
d) More number of trips to Government offices by citizen 
e) Expanded time window and convenient access

Expected e-government contributions include: 
a) Increase efficiency
b) Faster service delivery
c) Innovation in service delivery
d) Citizen participation
e) All of the above
Monitoring is collection and analysis of a data about a project or programme undertaken while the project/programme is ongoing. True/False

The following are method to evaluate e-government outcome except 
a) Survey 
b) Simulation 
c) Case study 
d) Field experiment
e) None of the above
Pathway to change maybe linear or non-linear. True/False

e-Government is about what?
a) About “e” 
b) About “computer”
c) About “website” 
d) About “transformation of  Government business process”
e) Above “translating Government business process”

Outputs start to bring about changes called ………….
a) Outcomes
b) Monitoring
c) Inputs
d) Outputs
e) Evaluation
Any M & E system or process designed is NOT to feed into management decision-making. True/False
M & E are outcomes orientated in nature. True/False

What are the two types of risks in the context of e-Government
a) Generic risk and Project-specific risk
b) Culture and Environment
c) People and Environment 
d) None of the Above
e) All of the Above

What are critical success factors in the context of e-Government?
a) They are those variables necessary to enable a desired outcome for an organization, project, policy or strategy
b) They are factors that must be in place to create a successful environment for a desired project outcome
c) None of the above
d) All of the above
e) They are factors that must be implemented promptly, objectively and timely to achieve a desired result

What is a Risk Factor?
a) Any attribute, characteristic or exposure of project, policy, organization that increase the likelihood of failure
b) I don't know
c) It does not exist in e-Government project
d) None of the above
e) All of the above

What is Nigeria's solution to e-Government failure?
a) IT Project Clearance
b) National Digital Economy Policy Strategy
c) National Broadband Plan
d) All of the above
e) None of the above

What was the major factor of Korea's e-Government's success?
a) Strong political leadership and strategic approach
b) Finance
c) Legal and regulatory framework
d) None of the above
e) All of the above

What was the major challenge to e-Government initiatives in Nigeria according to a study carried out by NITDA in 2019?
a) Finance
b) Leadership failure
c) Digital Divide
d) Infrastructure
e) Human Resource workforce

What are the categories of risks that can block or constrain e-Government implementation in developing countries?
a) Leadership failure, financial inhibitor, insufficient skill
b) They are those variables of circumstances necessary to enable a positive outcome for an organization, project or strategy
c)
